pages.title: About Pigment
pages.text: Pigment is a full-feature mod about magic and exploration.

Pigment is based on color mixing of the subtractive color system (CMYK). Subtractive color mixing may be familiar to you from painting with watercolors or printing.$(br2)Pigments main colors are represented by minerals, found in geodes scattered around the world, with the vanilla Amethyst representing the Magenta part of the spectrum.

Pigment comes with a builtin progression system based on advancements.$(br)As you delve deeper into Pigment you will notice changes in the world. Differences, that only you can perceive.$(br2)Everything you learn will bring you closer to your final destination: Finding out what is waiting for you beneath the up until then impenetrable bedrock floor.

Pigments design principles:$(br)Pigment is designed to create feelings of curiosity and wonder$(li)The guidance through the mod in form of advancements is done via atmospheric and immersive formulated tips$(li)If anything seems hard or cumbersome the first time it will reveal a path which is much easier to follow afterwards
Magical machines and tools are designed in a way so tasks that are not much fun in vanilla (like grinding good enchantments) are taken care of$(li)There is no "one block does all the things". Each entity is as simple as possible, but is designed to be creatively combined to invite experimentation.$(li)Some blocks / rituals / items have great power. If you are not careful, it is quite possible that something will be destroyed. However, players should be introduced slowly to such dangerous hazards.$(li)Absolutely no microcrafting (everyone hates microcrafting)
Pigment is still in heavy development. If you find a bug or have a suggestion visit me on github!
